alert.note: Alert for Coastal Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued March 09 at 11:53AM EST until March 10 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Gulf County Beaches including South Saint Joseph Peninsula and Indian Pass Beaches. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...At this time, North St. Joseph Peninsula, including Rish Park and T.H. Stone St. Joseph Peninsula State Park are flying YELLOW FLAGS. Pay close attention to local officials making any changes to flags flying at the beaches this afternoon.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
